facts.fact: Did you know that honey never spoils? Archaeologists have found pots of honey in ancient Egyptian tombs that are over 3000 years old and still perfectly edible.
Octopuses have three hearts and blue blood. Two hearts pump blood to the gills, while the third pumps it to the rest of the body.
Bananas are berries, but strawberries aren't. Botanically, a berry is a fruit produced from the ovary of a single flower with seeds embedded in the flesh.
The Eiffel Tower can be 15 cm taller during the summer due to thermal expansion of the metal.
A group of flamingos is called a 'flamboyance'. These birds get their pink color from the carotenoids in the algae and crustaceans they eat.
The Great Wall of China is not visible from space with the naked eye, contrary to popular belief. This myth has been debunked by astronauts.
A single cloud can weigh more than a million pounds. Despite this enormous weight, clouds float because the air around them is even denser.
Sharks have been around longer than trees. Sharks evolved around 400 million years ago, while trees appeared around 350 million years ago.
The human brain uses about 20% of the body's total energy, despite only making up about 2% of body weight.
There are more possible games of chess than there are atoms in the observable universe. The number of possible chess games is estimated to be 10^120.
Butterflies taste with their feet. They have chemoreceptors on their feet that help them identify suitable plants for laying eggs.
The International Space Station travels at approximately 17,500 mph (28,000 km/h) and orbits Earth every 90 minutes.
A bolt of lightning is about 5 times hotter than the surface of the sun, reaching temperatures of about 30,000 Kelvin (53,540Â°F).
The oldest known living tree is a Great Basin bristlecone pine named Methuselah, which is over 4,850 years old.
Your stomach gets an entirely new lining every 3-4 days because stomach acid would otherwise digest it.
The shortest war in history lasted only 38-45 minutes. It was between Britain and Zanzibar in 1896.
A day on Venus is longer than its year. Venus takes 243 Earth days to rotate once, but only 225 Earth days to orbit the Sun.
The human eye can distinguish approximately 10 million different colors.
Wombat droppings are cube-shaped. This unique shape helps prevent the droppings from rolling away, allowing wombats to mark their territory effectively.
The first computer bug was an actual bug. In 1947, Grace Hopper found a moth trapped in a relay of Harvard's Mark II computer.

source.fact_text: A group of flamingos is called a 'flamboyance'.
Wombat poop is cube-shaped. This unique shape prevents the feces from rolling away, marking their territory effectively.
The shortest war in history was between Britain and Zanzibar on August 27, 1896. Zanzibar surrendered after 38 minutes.
A day on Venus is longer than a year on Venus. It takes about 243 Earth days to rotate once on its axis, but only about 225 Earth days to orbit the Sun.
The world's largest desert is Antarctica. While most people think of deserts as hot, a desert is defined by its low precipitation.
Sharks are older than trees. Sharks have existed for around 400 million years, while trees appeared about 350 million years ago.
